title: Sectional Mock 7 - English
instruction: Given below are some statements with their first part given. The other parts are scrambled and arranged. You need to rearrange them in a logical and coherent manner and choose the option which depicts the correct arrangement. If there is no need for re-arrangement, please select option E.

quiz.text: What does the author mean by the phrase ‘the transformation has led to a stark financial polarization’ as used in the passage?
options: The deterioration of social norms has benefited only the wealthy and the knowledgeable while the vulnerable class of people has fallen into a debt trap
Since moral inhibitions no longer exist, the debt agents provide loans only to the affluent class thus widening the gap between the rich and the poor
The debt culture is being utilized as a measure to draw money from the wealthy class by credit card companies
Both A and B
None of the above

quiz.text: Which of the following statements would weaken the argument made by the author in the given paragraph?
options: A newspaper article reported an improvement in the lifestyle to millions of people after loans were made easy to avail to not only the wealthy but to all sections of society
A man along with his family was forced to live on streets after he lost all of his life’s earning to buy lottery tickets
Profit earned from credit card companies has become an essential component in the economy of a growing nation
Last year’s recession was mainly due to losses incurred by companies offering loans as a large number of their clients turned out to be defaulters
None of the above

quiz.text: Which of the following suggestions have been made by the author in order to check the culture promoting debts? 1. Putting a ban on the companies providing credit cards indiscriminately. 2. Taking the help of information institutions to limit the business of money lending by payday lenders. 3. Raising public awareness about negative effects of injudicious borrowing of money. 4. Taking action against governments which have been allowing lottery in their States.
options: Both 1 and 3
Only 4
Both 3 and 4
Both 2 and 3
None of these

quiz.text: Which of the following, according to the author, has/have been responsible for the encouragement of culture of debt in the society lately? 1. The changing lifestyle which makes it impossible for a common man to sustain himself without debts and loans. 2. Breaking down of moral institutions which supported economic prudence. 3. Provision for easy availability of loans to every section of the society regardless of their ability to repay these.
options: Only 1
Only 2
Both 1 and 3
Both 2 and 3
None of these

quiz.text: Which of the following can be the most appropriate title for the given passage?
options: The debt Culture and government initiatives of curtail it
Breaking social barriers-taking the route of financial indulgence
Accumulation of debt-a lesson for the future generations
Effect of ‘consumerism’ on the world market
Lack of perseverance for saving money in India

quiz.text: Which of the following is true in context of the passage?
options: Ever since its existence, money has ruined lives owing to lack of awareness among people regarding its unrestricted usage
Government has taken many initiatives to control the rampant money lending business to protect vulnerable sections of the society
Governments throughout the world have been putting tax on amount of consumption of an individual rather than his/her income
Credit card companies are discreet enough to provide credit cards to only those people who guarantee repaying money in the future
None is true

quiz.text: Find the error in one of the following fragments/parts.
options: The government has started a
new diplomatic policy with a view
to improve relations with
the neighbouring countries
No Error

quiz.text: Find the error in one of the following fragments/parts.
options: The youngster, who has been awarded
the sport's day award, have represented
India in countries like U.S., France, and
even thrice in Pakistan along with others.
No error

quiz.text: Find the error in one of the following fragments/parts.
options: As political scientist Christophe Jaffrelot argues in his book,
India’s Silent Revolution, the evolution of India’s post-Independence polity — from
being dominated with a single party to a multifarious, deeply “regionalised” system
was made possible by a “silent revolution” of the lower castes.
No error

options: lighten
cushion
ameliorate
choke
aggravate

options: revise
transfigure

stagnate

options: spree
rival

quiz.text: 4
options: suspicion
risk

boast
none of these

options: existing
for
comprising

none of these

options: acclaim
recognize
hail
kudize
root from

quiz.text: 7
options: elicit
illusion
interrelation
intellectual
None of these

quiz.text: Which of the following would be the FOURTH sentence after rearrangement?
options: F
H
E
B
G

quiz.text: Which of the following would be the LAST BUT ONE sentence after rearrangement?
options: C
A
D
G
H

quiz.text: Which of the following would be the SECOND sentence after rearrangement?
options: F
E
B
D
C

quiz.text: Which of the following would be the FIFTH sentence after rearrangement?
options: H
F
E
B
D

quiz.text: Which of the following would be the FIRST sentence after rearrangement?
options: E
C
G
F
A

quiz.text: What is the primary purpose of the author of the passage?  I. to highlight the significance of the strategy adopted by IMO to reduce the emissions by shipping industry which would help tackle climate change II. to highlight the contribution of shipping and aviation industry in the total volume of emissions and its impact on climate. III. to study the impact of climate change on low lying island nations and address their concerns of emissions from the shipping industry
options: Only I
Only II
Only I and III
Only II and III
All of the above

quiz.text: Which out of the following can be inferred from the passage?
options: Shipping and Aviation is regulated individually by the member counties of the UN which has made it difficult to set a target for emission control.
Shipping industry is the largest contributor of carbon-dioxide emissions among other industries.
The Paris Climate agreement aims to reduce the average global temperature by 1.5 Celsius or 2.7 degrees Fahrenheit.
It would be difficult to switch to energy source with low carbon footprint for container ships.
None of the above

quiz.text: Out of the given statements, which one is Dan Rutherford likely to agree with? I. Shipping emissions annually are equivalent to the emissions of Germany. II. If the shipping industry emissions continue to grow at the current rate then they would eat into the global carbon budget. III. The current strategy to curtail shipping industry emissions is not strong enough and the proposed limits are way lower than the required emission levels.
options: Only I
Only II
Only I and III
Only II and III
All of the above

quiz.text: Which among the following is similar in meaning to the word 'consistent' as used in the passage?
options: congruous
fickle
steady
wavering
None of the above

quiz.text: As per the passage, what are the problems which are common to both shipping and aviation industry?
options: Both aviation and shipping industry require intensive investments.
Both aviation and shipping industry are vulnerable to automation.
Both aviation and shipping industry are difficult to decarbonize as it is not commercially viable to do so.
Both aviation and shipping industry are difficult to decarbonize as it is difficult to power large vessels and planes through renewable energy.
Both C and D

quiz.text: Which among the following statements represents the view of US regarding the strategy formulated by a committee of the International Maritime Organization?
options: US has shown unequivocal support for the strategy and has applauded IMO for its realistic approach.
US has supported the strategy formulated by the IMO but it is concerned with the emission targets set by IMO.
US is sceptical about the strategy and its is of the view that setting of a reduction target is premature.
US has dismissed the strategy and accused member nations of conspiracy to destabilize its economy.
None of the above

quiz.text: Which among the following is similar in meaning to the word 'deliberations' as used in the passage?
options: dispute
contemplation
bedlam
tribute
None of above

quiz.text: The vicious cycle of violence in… A. stems from a failure of the mainstream B. political parties to implement their core vision C. the Kashmir Valley, that has affected civilians, D. military forces and separatists, fundamentally
options: CDBA
BCDA
CDAB
ACBD
No rearrangement required

quiz.text: Substitution between natural capital and man-made capital… A. agents internalize the costs where destruction is inevitable B. is an inevitable part of economic development but an C. audit of natural assets will incentivize us to figure out D. the least-polluting ways of economic development, and help
options: CBAD
ADBC
BCDA
BDAC
No rearrangement required
